summary: This document is an email chain from November 27, 2019, forwarded within the FBI's New York Office. It originates from a Norwegian journalist who claims to have information about a Norwegian businesswoman who was a passenger on Jeffrey Epstein's private plane in 1996-1997. The journalist provides flight log details and offers to facilitate contact between the FBI and the potential witness.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The central figure in the case; the document references his private plane and flight logs from 1996-1997.

persons.name: Compton
persons.context: A person who initially contacted the NYOC (likely New York Office of the FBI) claiming to work for a Norwegian magazine and who had contact with a female passenger on Epstein's plane. She seemed nervous when asked for contact information.

connections.description: Compton is an intermediary who claims to have contact with a female passenger who flew on Epstein's plane, suggesting a potential indirect connection between Epstein and the witness via Compton.

events.title: Flight from Teterboro to Palm Beach
events.description: A flight on Jeffrey Epstein's private plane from Teterboro, New York to Palm Beach, Florida, as recorded in a flight log.

events.title: Second Flight from Teterboro to Palm Beach
events.description: A second flight on Jeffrey Epstein's private plane from Teterboro, New York to Palm Beach, Florida, as recorded in a flight log.

events.title: Norwegian Journalist Contacts FBI
events.description: A journalist from a Norwegian publication emails the FBI's New York Office with information about a potential witness (a Norwegian businesswoman) who flew on Epstein's plane in 1996-1997.

keyFacts: A Norwegian journalist contacted the FBI in November 2019 with information about a Norwegian businesswoman who was a passenger on Jeffrey Epstein's private plane in 1996 and 1997.
The journalist provided specific flight log details showing flights from Teterboro, NY to Palm Beach, FL on August 18, 1996, and September 12, 1996.
The intermediary, Compton, appeared nervous when asked for the potential witness's contact information by the FBI's New York Office.
The document indicates the FBI was actively seeking to speak with anyone who was a passenger on Epstein's plane, as part of their investigation.
